window

Class SplashScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • window.SplashScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class SplashScreen
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class contains the splashscreen panel which fades in an image. Time spent: 20 minutes
    Version:
    2.0 May 18, 2014., 3.0 May 30, 2014. - No changes made., 4.0 June 6, 2014.

    Changes: In the splashscren, the user is presented with a letter congratulating them for becoming a police officer., 5.0 June 12, 2013 - Enter key works. The user must now enter a game name that is less than or equal to 10 characters in length before proceeding to the main menu.

    Author:
    StackOverflow (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/20346661/java-fade-in-and-out-of-images), Joshua Yuan, George Lim
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SplashScreen

        public SplashScreen()
        Constructor initializes the instance variables, starts the timer, and loads the high scores file.

        Anonymous inner Thread class documentation: run() loads the high scores and instruction images while the splashscreen is being animated.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserName

        private void getUserName()
        Asks the user to enter their game name before they can proceed to the main menu. The try-catch catches a potential FontFormatException and IOException. The first block of code sets the font and the layout. The second block of code sets properties of the JButton. The third block of code sets properties for the userName JTextField.

        About the inner class: Provides a document listener to the SIGNED JButton. changedUpdate () determines the action to perform if a change has been made. removeUpdate () determines the action to perform if text has been removed. verifyName () determines whether or not the SIGNED button should be visible, depending on the length of the current text. The if structure checks if text has been entered.

        Parameters:
        font - Font reference: The font used for this method - arabella.ttf.
        layout - SpringLayout reference: The layout of this panel.
        SIGNED - final JButton reference: When clicked, the program proceeds to the main menu.
        e - FontFormatExcetion, IOException references: References the 2 exception classes for error handling. DocumentEvent reference in inner class: Contains information about the document event.
        Throws:
        java.awt.FontFormatException - if there is an error that occurs while formating the newly created font.
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error that occurs while parsing the font file.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overrides paintComponent in JPanel to draw a fading splash screen image. The if structure checks if the value of alpha is less than 1.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics reference: Allows the method to draw an image to the panel.
        g2d - Graphics2D reference: Allows the use of the setComposite method which allows for alpha transparency.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Darkens the image by increasing the value of 'alpha'. The outer if structure determines whether the action event has been fired by the Timer or the arrow button. The first inner if structure checks if the userName is equal to pokilang, in which case cheat mode will be activated. The second inner if structure checks if the value of alpha is greater than 1. The if structure nested within the second inner if structure checks if yPos is equal to 0. The most nested if structure checks if yPos is equal to 349.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - ActionEvent reference that stores the action passed in to trigger this method.
        al - CompoundedFrame al: Points to the frame which contains this panel.
